column57: 5: hand (especially when playing cards; this is a recent extended meaning)
column63: murntu 'many, much, four' is 'used by younger speakers for the counting number 4'; raka '5' is 'a recent word; there is no connection in meaning between 'five' and 'disobedient''; kalyu '6' is 'used because of the similar appearance of "6" to a rain-drop'; ŋarlukutu '8' is 'used because of the appearance of the gall when split in two'; karrpu '9' is used because of the small circle on the top of the number'; tawu '10' is 'a recent work, used because of the similar appearance of "1" to a spear, and "0" to a spear-thrower'; see ASEDA 0504 for counting words (1,2,3,5,7,10 overlap with numeral quantifiers)
